mapper.select: select user_no , user_name , user_phone , user_gender , to_char(to_date(user_birth), 'YYYY/ MM/ DD') as "user_birth" from tb_user where user_type = 'P' and user_status = 'Y' and user_pt = 'N' and user_no = #{ userNo }
mapper.update: update tb_user set user_pt = 'Y' where user_no = #{userNo}
mapper.select: select book_no , user_no , user_name , emp_name , cl_no , book_date , book_stime , book_etime , book_status , cl_status from tb_booking join tb_user using(user_no) join tb_emp using(emp_no) where emp_no = #{empNo}
select user_no , user_name , user_gender , user_birth , user_phone , cl_no , cl_sdate , cl_count from tb_user join tb_class using (user_no) where emp_no = #{empNo}

select user_no , cl_no , emp_no , user_height , user_weight , cl_sdate , cl_count , cl_goal , cl_result , user_name , user_phone , user_gender , user_birth , user_profile_url from tb_class join tb_user using(user_no) where cl_no = #{classNo} and user_status = 'Y'
select cl_no , ex_date , ex_writer , ex_title , ex_count , ex_set , ex_coment , ex_link , ex_status , ex_no , ex_weight from tb_exercise where cl_no = #{classNo} order by ex_no
select count(*) as ex_count , ex_date from tb_exercise group by ex_date having count(*) > 0
select count(*) as ex_set , ex_date , ex_status from tb_exercise where ex_status = 'Y' group by ex_date, ex_status having count(*) > 0

select cl_no , ex_date , ex_writer , ex_title , ex_count , ex_set , ex_coment , ex_link , ex_status , ex_no , ex_weight from tb_exercise where cl_no = #{classNo} and ex_date = #{exDate} order by ex_no
select cl_no , ex_date , ex_writer , ex_title , ex_count , ex_set , ex_link , ex_status , ex_no , ex_weight from tb_exercise where ex_no = #{exNo}

select di_no , cl_no , di_date , di_bf_content , di_bf_img , di_lc_content , di_lc_img , di_dn_content , di_dn_img , di_enroll , di_re_content , di_re_img from tb_diet where cl_no = #{classNo} order by di_date

select di_no , cl_no , di_date , di_bf_content , di_bf_img , di_lc_content , di_lc_img , di_dn_content , di_dn_img , di_enroll , di_re_content , di_re_img , user_no from tb_diet join tb_class using (cl_no) where di_date = #{dietDate} and cl_no = #{classNo}
select re_no , re_writer , writer_name , re_content , to_char(re_date, 'YYYY.MM.DD HH24:MI:SS') as "re_date" , writer_type from tb_reply where re_status = 'Y' and di_no = #{dietNo} order by re_no
